title: Creamy Beef Tips with Egg Noodles Recipe
description: Cubed sirloin tips baked in cream of mushroom soup, red wine, milk, mixed with beef and beef onion soup mix. Served over egg noodles.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Beef Beef Stroganoff Recipes Creamy Beef Tips with Egg Noodles 4.6 (43) 35 Reviews 20 Photos Cubed sirloin tips baked in cream of mushroom soup, red wine, milk, mixed with beef and beef onion soup mix. Served over egg noodles. Great with dinner rolls or garlic toast. Submitted by Candi Riccardelli Updated on October 11, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 20 20 20 20 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 6 hrs 10 mins Total Time: 6 hrs 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 pounds sirloin tips, cubed ½ yellow onion, chopped 2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of mushroom soup (such as Campbell’s) 1 cup milk ½ cup red wine 1 (1.25 ounce) package beef with onion soup mix 2 (16 ounce) packages egg noodles Directions Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute beef sirloin tips with onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned, about 5 minutes. Stir cream of mushroom soup, milk, red wine, and beef with onion soup mix together in a bowl, pour into the skillet, and stir to coat beef in the soup mixture; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, place a cover on the skillet, and cook until the beef tips are tender, about 2 hours. Reduce heat to lowest setting and continue cooking until the beef pulls apart easily with a fork, at least 4 hours more. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain. Ladle beef tips mixture over egg noodles. France C I Made It Print 169 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Beef Tips with Egg Noodles 01 of 20 Photo by  France C 02 of 20 Photo by  France C 09/30/2024 OK with tweaks A very tasty recipe with surprisingly lots of flavor for such few ingredients. I recommend searing the meat in 2 batches, in order not to overcrowd the pan (which causes a lot of liquid to be released and steaming to occur). This will ensure you get a nice browning on the meat, which will in turn make the sauce darker, instead of a pale, unappealing color. There are way too many noodles for the amount of meat. ONE bag is plenty, and you’ll get 6 good sized servings from this dish. I also found 6 hours is a bit long for the sirloin tips. Some pieces were starting to dry out. 3-4 hours would be plenty long. 03 of 20 Photo by  dknight0909 05/10/2021 04 of 20 Photo by  Sandy Rodriguez Gentz 03/09/2021 05 of 20 Photo by  Christine Jewell 02/08/2021 06 of 20 Photo by  Clayton Boutelle 11/22/2020 07 of 20 Photo by  Dedra379 09/01/2020 I halved the recipe & added more wine. It was awesome!!! I also used no yolks whole grain noodles!! 08 of 20 Photo by  Dedra379 09/01/2020 I halved the recipe & added more wine. It was awesome!!! I also used no yolks whole grain noodles!! 09 of 20 Photo by  Sandy Angell 05/14/2020 10 of 20 Photo by  Char-Lin Mortensen 04/19/2020 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Simple Hamburger Stroganoff 1,107 Ratings Hamburger Stroganoff 70 Ratings Beef Stroganoff with White Wine 33 Ratings Stroganoff 213 Ratings No Sour Cream Beef Stroganoff 124 Ratings Beef Stroganoff for Instant Pot 982 Ratings Beef Stroganoff Casserole 2 Ratings Best Home-Style Beef Stroganoff 18 Ratings So Simple Beef Stroganoff 184 Ratings Daria's Slow Cooker Beef Stroganoff 1,106 Ratings Cream Cheese Steak Stroganoff 17 Ratings Slow Cooker Beef Stroganoff 4,213 Ratings Rich and Creamy Beef Stroganoff 997 Ratings Instant Pot Beef and Noodles 3 Ratings Chef John's Classic Beef Stroganoff 758 Ratings Easy Beef Stroganoff in the Slow Cooker 49 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Candi Riccardelli
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute beef sirloin tips with onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned, about 5 minutes.;Stir cream of mushroom soup, milk, red wine, and beef with onion soup mix together in a bowl, pour into the skillet, and stir to coat beef in the soup mixture; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to low, place a cover on the skillet, and cook until the beef tips are tender, about 2 hours.;Reduce heat to lowest setting and continue cooking until the beef pulls apart easily with a fork, at least 4 hours more.;Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes. Drain.;Ladle beef tips mixture over egg noodles. France C
